remarks: If the metric ` M ` is "strongly finer" than ` N ` (meaning that there is a positive real constant ` R ` such that ` N ( x , y ) <_ R x. M ( x , y ) ` ), then total boundedness of ` M ` implies total boundedness of ` N ` .  (Using this theorem twice in each direction states that if two metrics are strongly equivalent, then one is totally bounded iff the other is.)  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 14-Sep-2015.)
statement:
equivtotbnd.1 $e |- ( ph -> M e. ( TotBnd ` X ) ) $.
equivtotbnd.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( Met ` X ) ) $.
equivtotbnd.3 $e |- ( ph -> R e. RR+ ) $.
equivtotbnd.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. X /\ y e. X ) ) -> ( x N y ) <_ ( R x. ( x M y ) ) ) $.
equivtotbnd $p |- ( ph -> N e. ( TotBnd ` X ) ) $.
$d M x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d R x y $.
$d X x y $.
$d ph x y $.
